titleStmt.title: The voyce of the laste trumpet blowen bi the seue[n]th angel (as is me[n]tioned in the eleuenth of the Apocalips) callynge al the estates of menne to the right path of their vocation, wherin are contayned xii. lessons to twelue seueral estates of menne, whych if they learne and folowe, al shal be well and nothynge amise.
titleStmt.author: Crowley, Robert, 1518?-1588.

titleStmt.title: The voyce of the laste trumpet blowen bi the seue[n]th angel (as is me[n]tioned in the eleuenth of the Apocalips) callynge al the estates of menne to the right path of their vocation, wherin are contayned xii. lessons to twelue seueral estates of menne, whych if they learne and folowe, al shal be well and nothynge amise.
titleStmt.author: Crowley, Robert, 1518?-1588.

publicationStmt.publisher: By [R. Grafton for] Robert Crowley dwelling in Elie rentes in Holburne,
publicationStmt.date: The yere of oure Lorde God. M.D.XLIX. [1549] the. xxix. daie of Nouembre]

notesStmt.note: Signed below colophon: Autore eodem Roberto Croleo.
Imprint from colophon; actual printer's name from STC.
The last two leaves are blank.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
